image.altText: Riddoch Highway sign shows directional pointers to Penola, Mt Gambier, Keith and Naracoorte

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old girl has become the second person to die in a three-car smash in South Australia's south-east. The teenager and a five-year-old boy, who died at the scene on Sunday, were passengers in a car that was rear-ended.

title.children: Second child dies after three-car crash involving emu

image.altText: Raina Cruise wearing sunglasses outdoors

props.synopsis: A female police officer was pregnant when she was assaulted by anti-vaccine protester and failed South Australian Senate candidate Raina Cruise in Adelaide's CBD, a court has heard.

title.children: Police officer assaulted by woman outside pub was pregnant at the time, court told

image.altText: A hand holding orange dirt.

props.synopsis: Rare earths are seen as a strategic and economic opportunity for Australia, but some producers worry it could come at the cost of rich farmland.

title.children: Rare earth elements are key to Australia's energy transition. But not all are happy to dig them up

image.altText: Doctor Caitlin Sum standing near her clinic

props.synopsis: Australian doctors are turning to social media to secure specialist appointments for their patients, as it becomes increasingly difficult to determine who has open books.

title.children: Social media now a go-to resource for GPs seeking specialists

image.altText: Simon Middleton

props.synopsis: Prosecutors dropped a murder charge against Matthew Harmati, who was one of two men accused of the shooting death of Simon Middleton in Adelaide's north in 2021.

title.children: Prosecution drops murder charge over 'execution-style' killing

image.altText: Person sitting on a couch working on a laptop

props.synopsis: A tribunal finds a council employee who tripped over a 60-centimetre pet fence during a coffee break while working from home is entitled to workers compensation.

title.children: Council employee who tripped over pet fence while working from home wins compensation claim

image.altText: A burnt out battery.

props.synopsis: Australia's annual lithium-ion battery waste is tipped to hit 137,000 tonnes by 2035, and with 90 per cent of current waste going into landfill or getting stockpiled, there are urgent calls for dedicated recycling facilities.

title.children: Australia has 'urgent' need to establish lithium-ion recycling facilities as toxic waste soars

image.altText: A smiling elderly lady in a blue sweater holding an orchid in her home garden with more plants behind her.

props.synopsis: Nancy Murdock has been part of the Riverland Relay for Life event for 17 years, but the three-time cancer survivor has taken her last lap around the oval.

title.children: Nancy has lost six family members to cancer and survived it three times. Yet, she is 'hopeful' about the future

image.altText: A man in a high vis vest smiles at the camera leaning against a shelf in an isle

props.synopsis: Having paid employment allows Riverland's Bryce Westbrook to live more independently. He wants to inspire others with intellectual disabilities to follow their dreams.

title.children: People always say hello to Bryce when shopping. He's changing people's ideas about disability and ability

image.altText: Kyra Cooney-Cross launches the ball towards goal

props.synopsis: The Matildas have come from behind to beat Germany 2-1 in Duisburg thanks to maiden international goals from Kyra Cooney-Cross and Clare Hunt.

title.children: Cooney-Cross wonder strike gives Matildas hard-fought win against Germany

image.altText: A graphic shows a government plan laid over a shot of Queensland Parliament.

props.synopsis: Moments after being sworn into office, Queensland Premier David Crisafulli has assured reporters he is hard at work recalibrating the "machinery of government" as his deputy unveiled a four-page "bible" that will keep the LNP accountable.

title.children: With 99 days to go, Queensland's new leader outlines his immediate plan

image.altText: A farmer on a tractor moving on a field of dirt with mountains in the distance

props.synopsis: Farming and aid groups are warning the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah could affect food supplies in Lebanon and Syria and push hundreds of thousands of people into long-term poverty.

title.children: Olive oil, bananas and avocado: How Israel and Hezbollah's deadly war is impacting much-needed food supplies

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says pokies companies' use of tax credits designed to promote innovation is "problematic".

title.children: Pokies, pizza and precision weapons companies all eligible for innovation tax credits

image.altText: Saltmarsh driver 4

props.synopsis: These saltmarshes entice many people in for a 4WD adventure, but motorists are destroying the "underrated heroes" of the Great Barrier Reef ecosystem.

title.children: Drivers tear up saltmarshes at popular Queensland tourism spot, damaging sensitive and vital ecosystem

image.altText: A woman holds and looks down at a baby onesie while standing in a room.

props.synopsis: Nicky has been living in a two-bedroom motel with her children after rental demand skyrocketed in south-east Queensland.

title.children: Pregnant mother with 'guaranteed income' left homeless after almost 100 unsuccessful rental applications

image.altText: A data centre containing rows of computer equipment.

props.synopsis: Huge data centres built for generative AI will generate millions of tonnes of electronic waste by 2030, the equivalent of discarding billions of smartphones each year, a study suggests.

title.children: Massive new AI data centres will generate millions of tonnes of electronic waste

image.altText: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un

props.synopsis: The United States says the troops have been sent to train in eastern Russia and are expected to help Russia's war in Ukraine over the next several weeks.

title.children: Some 10,000 North Korean troops have been sent to Russia, Pentagon says

image.altText: colours and numbers light up a gaming machine

props.synopsis: A gambler's losses while playing electronic gaming machines would have been capped as part of a harm-minimisation system which was soon to be implemented in Tasmania, however advocates say a new statement by the premier is the clearest signal yet the plan will be spiked.

title.children: Advocates say nation-leading pokies reform at risk after Tasmanian Premier flags 'more measured approach'

image.altText: photo portrait of Bernard Fanning in a grey suit and open red shirt

props.synopsis: He's the frontman of one of Australia's biggest bands, and the only singer to have topped triple j's Hottest 100 three times. But Powderfinger's Bernard Fanning has always had self doubt and, as he tells Zan Rowe on Take 5, almost gave up on a music career entirely.

title.children: Powderfinger were one of Australia's biggest bands. But frontman Bernard Fanning felt like an imposter

image.altText: A woman pokes her head through a bookshelf in a library.

props.synopsis: Us and the Night, by Melbourne-based filmmaker Audrey Lam, is a tender look at libraries, friendship and imagination, showing as part of a "cosmic double feature" at Adelaide Film Festival.

title.children: A quiet university library turns into a cosmic playground for two girls in this playful, dreamy film

image.altText: A neon sign of an eagle in orange and green words that say "Rivers" affixed to the side of a building.

props.synopsis: Mosaic Brands, the Australian fashion retail company behind clothing brands including Rivers, Katies and Millers, has been placed into voluntary administration.

title.children: Retailer behind Rivers, Katies and Millers enters voluntary administration, putting 3,000 jobs at risk

image.altText: night time shot of destroyed building with debris and rubble on the floor

props.synopsis: Several people have been injured in Russian air attacks on Ukraine's north-eastern Kharkiv region. Meanwhile, Ukrainian drones have targeted ethanol plants in Russia's Voronezh region.

title.children: Ukraine reports two dead in overnight Russian missile attacks

image.altText: Khadervali Gagguturu and Sharmila Kuttagula

props.synopsis: The family of the second pilot, 60-year-old Khadervali Gagguturu, have described him as "fearless" and "brilliant".

title.children: 'Heart of gold': Second pilot identified after horror light plane crash over Sydney

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump looking at each other in election illustration

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has headlined a rally at Madison Square Garden and a major newspaper is refusing to pick a winner — here's the latest updates from the US election.

title.children: Trump's Madison Square Garden appearance takes aim at Harris, migrants, Puerto Rico — the latest from the US election campaign trail

image.altText: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag

props.synopsis: The 54-year-old Dutchman's job was the subject of speculation for most of last season as United recorded their worst Premier League finish in eighth.

title.children: Manchester United sack manager Erik ten Hag as club legend takes over

image.altText: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei

props.synopsis: Tehran says Iran is using "all available means to respond firmly and effectively" to Israel's deadly strikes on Iranian military sites over the weekend.

title.children: Iran vows to 'respond firmly' to Israeli strikes on military sites

image.altText: David Crisafulli and wife Tegan thank his supporters at his victory party in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Queensland has sent a "decisive" warning to federal Labor, showing that throwing money at cynical voters is no guarantee the love will be reciprocated.

title.children: Labor says result is positive because it could have been much worse. Outside Brisbane, it's hard to see how

image.altText: Girl with blurred face dancing in a red tutu with elaborate gold embroidery

props.synopsis: The father of an emaciated girl who was removed from his care after he refused to allow medics to insert a feeding tube told hospital staff he thought BMI "was for fat people" and his daughter was "safe and happy", a Perth court hears.

title.children: 'BMI is for fat people', father accused of starving daughter told medics as they tried to get him to allow a feeding tube, court hears

image.altText: Moody image of a person dressed in dark work clothes

props.synopsis: Preliminary results of a global survey show Australia has some of the highest rates of work addiction. Managers, people with a demanding job and those with family members addicted to work are at the highest risk of developing a work addiction.

title.children: Work environment one of the contributing factors to work addiction, preliminary research finds

image.altText: Xiaozheng Lin stands against a grey backdrop in a police mug shot.

props.synopsis: A man who killed two sex workers in the space of 24 hours has struck a deal with prosecutors, allowing him to dodge a murder conviction.

title.children: Man who killed two Melbourne sex workers in 24 hours strikes manslaughter deal

image.altText: CCTV footage shows 'targeted' vandalism and theft at Canberra Hindu temple

props.synopsis: This is not the first time the buildings have been targeted by thieves and some community members say they are "horrified".

title.children: Two Hindu temples burgled, vandalised in broad daylight in Canberra

image.altText: a woman with a red blazer smiles inside a train station

props.synopsis: Travellers to Japan may have picked up on a familiar accent while riding the Shinkansen between Tokyo and the southern island of Kyushu.

title.children: Aussie voice actor invokes her 'inner Cate Blanchett' on Japan's busiest fast-rail route

image.altText: A woman in a white t-shirt walks through a suburban shopping centre carpark.

props.synopsis: A woman who received more than $718,000 from an insurance company after claiming she had died in a car accident in Broome is jailed.

title.children: Woman who faked her own death and collected $718,000 life insurance payout jailed

image.altText: CCTV footage from the back of a garbage truck which shows the bucket on fire and smoke billowing in to the street.

props.synopsis: A video of a lithium battery fire in the back of a Western Sydney garbage truck has prompted warnings to residents who leave dangerous goods in suburban bins.

title.children: Fourth garbage truck in a month catches fire in Lakemba after lithium battery ignites
